Is LaMelo Ball alright after the Charlotte crash?



Check out the video of the crash—

What's next for LaMelo Ball?



LaMelo Ball of Charlotte Hornets (Image via Getty)

On Wednesday afternoon LaMelo Ball was involved in a two-car crash in uptown. The incident occurred at the busy intersection of Trade and Tryon shortly after 4 p.m., according to local traffic records. Video from area outlets showed Ball’s camouflage-colored, custom 2022 GMC Hummer EV colliding with a charcoal sedan in the middle of the city.The key detail came soon after. A person familiar with the situation confirmed that the Charlotte Hornets guard was not injured. One individual from the crash was transported to a hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, according to medic officials. Police responded to the scene, though a full report was not immediately available. Ball later exited the vehicle wearing an aqua Hornets hoodie and left in another car.Yes. LaMelo Ball did not sustain injuries in the collision, according to a source told The Associated Press on condition of anonymity. Video footage showed him stepping out of the disabled truck calmly before departing the area.The impact appeared strong. The Hummer’s left front tire was completely torn off, and the vehicle came to rest blocking the city’s Gold Line streetcar tracks.Footage from WSOC-TV and other local outlets captured the aftermath as officers approached on foot. The driver of the other vehicle exited and walked toward Ball’s vehicle. There has been no public update on that driver’s condition beyond confirmation of non-life-threatening injuries.The crash took place hours after the Hornets completed practice. Charlotte has won 10 of its last 11 games and is set to host the Houston Rockets as the NBA resumes following the All-Star break.Ball was driving a custom-made, camouflage-wrapped GMC Hummer EV at the time of the accident. The electric truck sustained visible damage and had to be left at the scene. Reports indicate Ball later entered a trailing vehicle and was driven away.The 22-year-old guard is currently sidelined with a calf injury and last played on Feb. 11, when he scored 24 points against Atlanta. His status with the team remains unchanged following the crash. As of now, it is confirmed that Ball is alright; however, there is no report of his return to the court following the crash.
Article Summary: Charlotte Hornets guard LaMelo Ball was involved in a two-car crash on Wednesday afternoon. Ball was driving a custom-made, camouflage-wrapped GMC Hummer EV at the time of the accident. The 22-year-old guard is currently sidelined with a calf injury and last played on Feb. 11.

The Los Angeles Lakers are heading into the offseason without clarity on LeBron James’ future. He is 41, still productive, and on an expiring contract. He has not said whether he plans to return for a 24th season. That has left the organization and fans waiting.This uncertainty comes during a period of change for the franchise. In 2025, majority control was sold to Mark Walter. The team also traded Anthony Davis for Luka Dončić. She said, “Never say never, but he certainly hasn’t given any indication.” She added that James has earned the right to decide on his own terms.Buss also spoke about the team’s transition. She said the ownership partnership gives the franchise stability as it builds around Dončić. Her comments did not suggest that James is leaving, but they made clear that no decision has been made.As of mid-February, the Lakers are 33-21 and fifth in the Western Conference. They are competing for playoff position while managing a shift in leadership.James is in his 23rd season and playing on a $52.6 million player option. In 36 games, he is averaging:He also recorded the oldest triple-double in league history this season.Dončić has taken on a larger scoring role. After the All-Star Game on February 15, he said there are “so many more factors” involved in the decision. He added, “Once my body goes, then it’s a wrap.” He said the uncertainty does not affect his focus on the playoffs.At other times, he has made comments such as “I’ll never play again,” which led to more retirement talk.
